clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Continuous Noninvasive Arterial Pressure Measurement on Anaesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Continuous Noninvasive Arterial Blood Pressure Monitoring on Blood Pressure Stability During General Anaesthesia in Orthopedic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Continuous noninvasive blood pressure monitoring may help to avoid intraoperative Hypotension or Hypertension

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Hypotensive Events in comparison between both groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: During induction and maintainance of general anaesthesia (average estimated time = 3 hours)

primary_outcome.measure: Dosage of Norepinephrine given to the patient to maintain blood pressure normotensive
primary_outcome.time_frame: During induction and maintainance of general anaesthesia (average estimated time = 3 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of acute kidney failure postoperatively
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during hospital stay after surgical procedure (in average 3 days)

other_outcome.time_frame: consecutive full hours of general anaesthesia (estimated average 3 hours)

clinical_study.condition: Blood Pressure Stability in General Anaesthesia

arm_group.description: Patients receive continuous noninvasive blood pressure monitoring in addition to intermittent monitoring
Control group with intermittent blood pressure monitoring

intervention.intervention_name: continuous noninvasive blood pressure monitoring ClearSight-Device
intervention.description: Noninvasive continuous blood pressure monitoring using the volume clamp method (ClearSight-Device)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- orthopedic surgery in general anaesthesia
- American Society of Anesthesiologists - Physical Status (ASA) 2 or ASA 3
- arterial Hypertension
Exclusion Criteria:
-invasive blood pressure monitoring required

facility.name: Klinik für Anaesthesiologie am Klinikum der Universität München
